intro: Tephrosia delicata, commonly known as the delicate tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, featuring slender stems and trifoliate leaves. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in racemous inflorescences, and it produces small, round pods containing several seeds. Tephrosia delicata is often used in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
